byline.docAuthor: N. Nohara, S. Sekiguchi and K. Matsui

front.div:
2-Arylamino-4,6-dichloro-s-triazine reacts with cyanuric chloride in the presence of alkali to
yield N,N-bis(4,6-dichloro-s-triazin-2-yl)-arylamine. In like manner, 2-substituted o-chloro-, p-
chloro-, o-nitro-and p-carbomethoxyphenylamino-4,6-dimethoxy-s-triazines react with cyanuric
chloride to yield the corresponding 4,6-dichloro-s-triazin-2-yl-4',6'-dimethoxy-s-triazin-2'-y~ary~-
amine, while anilino-, p-toluidino, 0-and p-methoxyphenylamino and o-carbomethoxyphenyl-
amino derivatives did not.
The reaction of cyanuric chloride with 2,4-dichloro-6-ethylamino-s-triazine in the presence of
alkali yields the condensation product of the ditriazinylamine type and the reaction of cyanuric
chloride with ammonia yields N,N-bis(4,6-dichloro-s-triazin-2-y1)-or tris(4,6-dichloro-s-triazin-2-
yl)amine.
